job_title: Instructor Librarian in West Long Branch, NJ
pros: If you are in a favored discipline or department (business, athletics), it's a great place to work. Beautiful campus, great perks. Great pay scale if you are in one of these fields. Also catering and campus dining are excellent.
cons: If you are not in a favored discipline or department (humanities), it's demoralizing. Constant budget cuts, staff cuts, marginalization by administration. Students are pampered and spoiled, not much is asked of many of them, and they act like they can do no wrong. Pay scale is predominantly lower for female-dominated fields. Campus ethos is fairly conservative.

job_title: Resident Assistant (RA) in West Long Branch, NJ
pros: Flexible works hours, free room, $ towards meal plan, discount at the book store, make your own schedule.
cons: Lack of communication, ask for your advice then talk down to you, last-minute events, redundant training.

review_title: Adjuncting here is good but can be dead end
job_title: Adjunct Professor of English in West Long Branch, NJ
pros: MU pays 3,000 per course for teaching English first year composition. You can teach two courses. You get an office, reasonable parking, small classes, professional develpment, etc.
cons: Teaching at this institution is great, but, as with many universities, it is hard for an adjunct to move up and advance to Instructor, especially with a MA instead of a Ph. D. Most adjuncts who do this "for fun," will love it, but if you're trying to get a full time job teaching...it is very difficult.

review_title: Good place to work as a student
job_title: Assistant Videe Editor in West Long Branch, NJ
pros: As a university job, there was a lot of flexibility in the hours. I was paid well and treated even better by my boss. Now a graduate with a full-time job that i dislike, I miss this position greatly.
cons: Although a creative job, the guidelines for each video were very specific. Each project I created was critiqued by several others and then changes had to be made, usually resulting in work that was no longer my vision. There was also no room for growth.

review_title: Monmouth really is a great place to work
job_title: Assistant Professor in West Long Branch, NJ
pros: They offer fantastic benefits, and the campus is a great place to teach. It is beautiful, but also every classroom is up to date techonolgically. Most people stay many years at Monmouth, which shows how people care about the school. There is a lot of support for students, and most opportunities to enhance teaching and research are supported by the administration.
cons: For faculty, the workload can be extremely heavy. They are asked to do a lot, and not just tenure-track or tenured faculty.

review_title: Great benefits, great people, low pay
job_title: Department Secretary in West Long Branch, NJ
pros: Work/Life balance, benefits & insurance, beautiful campus & good work environment, union position
cons: Payscale, opportunity for advancement, staff positions have been treated as less valued than faculty/administrators in the past.

job_title: Computer Systems Analyst in West Long Branch, NJ
pros: Monmouth's Information Management department has excellent management and an environment suited for one's growth. Monmouth gives you EVERY opportunity to grow as a professional. Tuition Remission allows you to work towards a Bachelors or Masters degree essentially free of charge! Free gym on campus!
cons: Few opportunities for advancement. Due to various perks such as Tuition Remission, an on-campus gym, as well as other benefits, the compensation is not as competitive as the corporate world.

review_title: Great peers but not appreciated by management
job_title: Safety Officer in West Long Branch, NJ
pros: Tuition remission for dependants helps ease pain of weak salary. Venue for employment is great and dealing with college students is interesting and never boring1
cons: Underpaid as compaired to other officers in compairable schools of higher education. More moey could be allocated to all of the safety officers especially when dealing with the events taking place on campuses across our nation.

job_title: Human Resources Desk Assistant in Long Branch, NJ
pros: Everyone is happy and cheerful. they are willing to help. if you make a mistake they don't get upset with you. They make you do the tasks again and help you do it right. If in school they are flexible with your schedule.
cons: Only learned basic office work scanning, filing, and deliveries around campus.

review_title: It was a great learning and teaching experience to be a PLA for Freshman Seminar classes in the Fall 2012 semester.
job_title: Peer Learning Assistant in West Long Branch, NJ
pros: I learned a lot and was able to share my experiences with the class. I also was paid hourly for work done both inside and outside the classroom.
cons: There were really no cons I experienced while working as a PLA at Monmouth University. It was a great experience as a student.
